meanings.definition: The act of merging two or more things into one.
meanings.sent1: The conflation of flavors in the soup created a delicious taste.
meanings.sent2: The conflation of colors in the painting made it vibrant and eye-catching.
meanings.sent3: The conflation of socks in the laundry led to some interesting mismatched pairs.
meanings.sent4: Her conflation of music genres in the playlist was like a symphony of different sounds.
meanings.sent5: The conflation of scents in the garden was overwhelming yet pleasant.

meanings.definition: The combination or blending of different elements into a unified whole.
meanings.sent1: The conflation of ingredients in the recipe resulted in a unique dish.
meanings.sent2: The conflation of voices in the choir created a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent3: The conflation of styles in her outfit made her stand out in a good way.
meanings.sent4: The conflation of ideas in the meeting sparked a creative solution.
meanings.sent5: The conflation of textures in the fabric gave the dress a rich feel.
